SEARCH
Package hms.utils

Class Validator

java.lang.Object
hms.utils.Validator
public class Validator extends Object
Provides methods to validate various types of user inputs using a Scanner.

    • validateInt

      public static int validateInt(Scanner scanner)
      Validates that the input from the scanner is an integer.
      Parameters:
      scanner - The scanner to read the input from.
      Returns:
      The validated integer.

    • validateName

      public static String validateName(Scanner scanner)
      Validates that the input is a proper name string. Ensures the name does not have multiple spaces, not just spaces, and has a minimum length of 4 characters.
      Parameters:
      scanner - The scanner to read the input from.
      Returns:
      The validated and formatted name string.

    • validateContact

      public static int validateContact(Scanner scanner)
      Validates that the input from the scanner is a proper 8digit phone number, following convention
      Parameters:
      scanner - The scanner to read the input from.
      Returns:
      The validated number

    • validateStringNoSpace

      public static String validateStringNoSpace(Scanner scanner)
      Validates that the input string contains no spaces.
      Parameters:
      scanner - The scanner to read the input from.
      Returns:
      The validated string.

      public static String validateStringforFile(Scanner scanner)

      Parameters:

    • validateEmail

      public static String validateEmail(Scanner scanner)
      Validates that the input string is a valid email address. Assumes an email contains '@'.
      Parameters:
      scanner - The scanner to read the input from.
      Returns:
      The validated email string.

    • validateLine

      public static String validateLine(Scanner scanner)
      Validates that the input from the scanner is a non-blank string. Ensures that the string is not empty and contains characters other than just spaces.
      Parameters:
      scanner - The scanner to read the input from.
      Returns:
      The validated non-blank string.

    • validateChar

      public static char validateChar(Scanner scanner)
      Validates that the input from the scanner is a single character. Ensures that the input consists of exactly one character.
      Parameters:
      scanner - The scanner to read the input from.
      Returns:
      The validated character.

    • validateCharToUpper

      public static char validateCharToUpper(Scanner scanner)
      Validates a single character input and converts it to uppercase.
      Parameters:
      scanner - The scanner to read the input from.
      Returns:
      The validated and uppercase character.
